div.p: The WSO2 LB team is pleased to announce the release of version 1.0.0 of the Open Source Load Balancer (LB).

WSO2 LB is a fast, lightweight and user friendly open source Load Balancer (LB) distributed under the Apache Software License v2.0. WSO2 LB allows system administrators and developers to easily configure fail over routing, load balancing, service aware load balancing, and dynamic load balancing with auto scaling.The LB runtime is designed to be completely asynchronous, non-blocking and streaming based on the Apache Synapse mediation engine.

WSO2 LB 1.0.0 is developed on top of the revolutionary WSO2 Carbon platform (Middleware a' la carte), an OSGi based framework that provides seamless modularity to your SOA via componentization. This release also contains many new features and a range of optional components (add-ons) that can be installed to customize the behavior of the LB. Further, any existing features of the LB which are not required to your environment can be easily removed using the underlying provisioning framework of Carbon. In brief, WSO2 LB can be fully customized and tailored to meet your exact SOA needs.
You can download this distribution from http://wso2.org/downloads/lb and give it a try.

ol.li: Go to the bin directory in the extracted folder
Run the wso2server.sh or wso2server.bat as appropriate
Configure the load balancer to manage the load across the instants to be balanced.

If you need to start the OSGi console with the server use the property -DosgiConsole when starting the server. The INSTALL.txt file found on the installation directory will give you a comprehensive set of options and properties that can be passed into the startup script

ul.li: Non-blocking HTTP/S transports based on Apache HttpCore-NIO for ultra-fast execution and support for thousands of connections at high concurrency with constant memory usage.
Built in support for scheduling tasks using the Quartz scheduler.
Load-balancing (with or without sticky sessions)/Fail-over, and clustered Throttling and Caching support
Lightweight, XML and Web services centric messaging model
Automatically scaling the system according to the load across the nodes in the service nodes that are in the cluster.
Service aware dynamic load balancing - A single load balancer can centrally manage the load across the nodes of different service clusters.
